bibl.title: Amphorae from Italian Peninsula Found in Alexandria.
bibl.note: Alexandria-connected commercial relations had always been the vital spot of the economy of Egypt from the foundation of the city until the present-day. Summary of these activities of the merchants from Italian Peninsula to Alexandria due to the amphora evidence found during the salvage excavations of Centre d'Études Alexandrines since 1992. These data were also gathered from the shipwrecks which were sunk on the coastline of the city and excavated by our team and also from the Greco-Roman Museum collections found mostly from the famous Necropoleis of Alexandria. - Avec résumé en anglais.

bibl.title: "Immensa Aequora - Workshop. Ricerche archeologiche, archeometriche e informatiche per la ricostruzione dell'economia e dei commerci nel bacino occidentale del Mediterraneo (metà IV sec. a.C. - I sec. d.C.). Atti del convegno, Roma 24-26 gennaio 2011."

bibl.seg: Ahmet Kaan Şenol, Amphorae from Italian Peninsula Found in Alexandria.

Gloria Olcese (ed.), Immensa Aequora - Workshop. Ricerche archeologiche, archeometriche e informatiche per la ricostruzione dell'economia e dei commerci nel bacino occidentale del Mediterraneo (metà IV sec. a.C. - I sec. d.C.). Atti del convegno, Roma 24-26 gennaio 2011 (Roma, 2013) pp. 403-408, 21 figg.

Alexandria-connected commercial relations had always been the vital spot of the economy of Egypt from the foundation of the city until the present-day. Summary of these activities of the merchants from Italian Peninsula to Alexandria due to the amphora evidence found during the salvage excavations of Centre d'Études Alexandrines since 1992. These data were also gathered from the shipwrecks which were sunk on the coastline of the city and excavated by our team and also from the Greco-Roman Museum collections found mostly from the famous Necropoleis of Alexandria. - Avec résumé en anglais.
